content.value: The process of setting up a Linux operating system on a computer or virtual machine so that users can start using Linux features, applications, and commands.
content.example: Installing Ubuntu Linux on a laptop or inside VirtualBox.

content.value: Installing Linux allows users to learn, practice, and use Linux in real-world environments. Linux can be installed alongside another operating system or inside a virtual machine, making it safe and flexible for beginners. Learning installation also helps users understand system setup and configuration.

items: Install Linux on a physical computer
Install Linux using a virtual machine
Dual boot Linux with another operating system
Use Linux in live mode (without installation)

content.value: Why Beginners Should Use Virtual Machines

Virtual machines are best for beginners because they do not affect the existing operating system. If anything goes wrong, the virtual machine can be deleted and recreated easily. This makes learning Linux safe and stress-free.

items: No risk to your main operating system

content.value: Step By Step – Installing Linux Using VirtualBox

steps: Download and install VirtualBox on your computer
Download a Linux ISO file (for example, Ubuntu)
Open VirtualBox and create a new virtual machine
Select the downloaded Linux ISO file

content.value: Always choose Ubuntu for your first Linux installation because it is beginner-friendly and well-documented.
A desktop environment is the graphical user interface (GUI) that allows users to interact with Linux using windows, icons, menus, and mouse clicks instead of commands.
